member.name: T:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice
member.summary: Wash Head device The wash head is an \ref AccessibleDevices "accessible device" representing exactly one wash head module including the needed wash station. In difference to the standard washer the wash head will need a gripper device for washing.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_WashHead The interface includes - configuration properties for WashHead scaling factor and offset - a layout property for the WashHead slot - methods for wash volume and wash item conversions - methods for starting a wash process . \b Important: This device only supports full featured WashHeads. This WashHeads are able to process a full wash with a single command. The WashHead type adaption is done by the modules firmware.
%SWashHeadDevice class diagram
\image html "SWashHeadDevice.png"

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.GetErrorInfos

Error information provider
This method returns the default error messages for all errors which can be generated by this device.

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.HandleModuleError(System.Boolean,System.Object[])
member.summary: This method handles the module errors of SMotor devices
member.details: Possible Module types: - 0x0061 (\ref Sias::CanDev::eMODULE_TYPE_CONST::MT_SIAS_WASHER "MT_SIAS_WASHER") . Handled errors: - eMODULE_ERROR_CONST.ME_TIMEOUT_ERR - eMODULE_ERROR_CONST.ME_INIT_ERROR - eMODULE_ERROR_CONST.ME_INIT_ERROR2 - eMODULE_ERROR_CONST.ME_NOT_ALLOWED - eMODULE_ERROR_CONST.ME_NOT_INIT - eMODULE_ERROR_CONST.ME_CMD_ERROR1 - eMODULE_ERROR_CONST.ME_WRONG_VALVE .
member.param: true to force the handler to handle the error

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.StartWash(System.Byte,Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,System.UInt16,System.Double)
member.summary:
Start wash program execution.
This command starts the defined wash program on the washer.
\b Improtant: The wash head device does not support using wash programs by number! This method is only for compatibility to the interface it will alway result in an error!
member.param: The identifier of the wash program
The Item to wash (null for using the default plate definition)
Rows to wash (each bit represents a row)

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.StartWash(System.Byte,System.UInt16,System.Double)
member.summary:
Start wash program execution.
This method starts execution of the wash program identified by . For execution the plate definition of the actual item on the washer slot is used. If there is no item on washer slot the plate definition stored at the washer is used.
\b Improtant: The wash head device does not support using wash programs by number! This method is only for compatibility to the interface it will alway result in an error!
member.param: The identifier of the wash program
Rows to wash (each bit represents a row)

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.StartWash(Sias.WashManager.SWashProgramData,Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,System.UInt16,System.Double)
member.summary:
Start WashHead command.
This command starts the WashHead
member.param: Rows to wash (each bit represents a row)

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.StartWash(Sias.WashManager.SWashProgramData,System.UInt16,System.Double)
member.summary:
Start WashHead command.
This command starts the WashHead
member.param: Rows to wash (each bit represents a row)

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.DeleteWashProgram(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Delete wash program by number
\b Improtant: The wash head device does not support using wash programs by number! This method is only for compatibility to the interface it will alway result in an error!

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.SendWashProgramToWasher(Sias.WashManager.SWashProgramData,Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Transfer wash proecudre to washer transfer memory.
This method send the defined wash program together with the plate definitions of the given plate to the washer (in RAM section).
\b Improtant: The wash head device does not support using wash programs by number! This method is only for compatibility!
member.param: The item where to get the wash positions
Wash program index to store (only flash indexes: 9..127)
member.returns: True if wash program successfully send, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.SendWashProgramToWasher(Sias.WashManager.SWashProgramData,Sias.Core.Interfaces.IItem)
member.summary:
Transfer wash proecudre to washer transfer memory.
This method send the defined wash program together with the plate definitions of the given plate to the washer (in RAM section).
\b Improtant: The wash head device does not support using wash programs by number! This method is only for compatibility!
member.param: The item where to get the wash positions
member.returns: True if wash program successfully send, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.GetWashProgramFromWasher
member.summary:
Get wash program from washer
This method gets the actual wash program from washer (RAM section).
\b Improtant: The wash head device does not support using wash programs by number! This method is only for compatibility!
member.returns: The actual wash program or null if no actual wash program is stores.

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.GetWashProgramFromWasher(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Get wash program from washer
This method gets the actual wash program from washer (RAM section).
\b Improtant: The wash head device does not support using wash programs by number! This method is only for compatibility!
member.param: The wash program index to load
member.returns: The requested wash program or null if no wash program is stored with this id.

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.AttachLayoutData(Sias.Core.Interfaces.ILayoutDevice)
member.summary:
Attach layout data.
This method tries to attach the layout data found at the given layout device to the device. If this will succeed it returns true. If it fails it returns false. In this case the calling method should retry until it finds a fitting layout device.
member.param: The layout device to attach or null to unattach an attached layout device.
member.returns: true if attachable, false if not

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.GetAccessMode(System.Object)
member.summary: Get access mode. This Method is used to request the actual access mode.
member.returns: Access mode for the given caller object

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.SetAccessMode(System.Object,Sias.Core.Interfaces.SAccessMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set access mode. This method prepares the washer module to allow the requested access.
member.remarks: Remarks: - If the timeout is longer than the remaining washer time the function will not wait for the finished timeout. It will return inaccessible immediately. - There is not way to stop the washer yet, so AccessMode.RequestInterruption will of course not stop the washer. .

member.summary:
Get/Set the ScalingFactor of the SWasherDevice
The scaling factor defines the time in ms needed to dispense (wash) 1 µl

member.summary: Get/Set the ScalingOffset of the SWasherDevice [ms]

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.HeadOffset
member.summary:
Wash Head pick/drop offset property
This property is used to define a wash head pick/drop offset. As the wash head device may be used with different types of grippers it is neeed to adjust the gripper to the wash head. This offset defines the offset between the center of the gripper fingers and the center of the wash head take position.

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.HeadOrientationOffset
member.summary:
Wash head pick/drop orientation offset property
This configuration proterty can be used to define an orientation correction for picking/dropping the wash head.

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.WashOffset
member.summary:
Head wash offset property
This property defines the offset between the

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.WashOrientationOffset
member.summary:
Wash orientation offset property
This orientation offset is used to correct small orientation deviations between washable item, wash head and gripper orientation.

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.LiquidValves
member.summary: Liquid valve list property

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.WashHead
member.summary:
Wash head item layout property property
This layout property defines the wash head item. it will get picked with the gripper device. to wash the plate. It will only be valid, if a layout is attached (\b see \ref AttachLayoutData).

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.WashHeadParkSlot
member.summary:
Wash head park slot property
This property defines the wash head park slot. On startup the device expected to find the wash head on the wash head park slot.

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.PrimeOffset
member.summary:
Prime position offset property
The prime offset defines the distance between the wash head park slot on the prime position. The device will calculate the direction depending on the orientation of the wash head park slot.

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.Handling
member.summary:
Active Handling methods property
This property is used as handling methods to move the Items to the PlateTrax device. On default the first handling method block of the PlateTrax robot is used.

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.PrimePosition
member.summary: Prime position property

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.DoStopWashing
member.summary: Stop washing flag property

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ValveDispenseMode
member.summary: Check if valve or pump dispense mode is configured

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ValveAspirateMode
member.summary: Check if valve or pump Aspirate mode is configured

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.IsWashing
member.summary: Check if wash head is active (wash thread is running)

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.PauseWash
member.summary:
Pause washing flag
This property is used to pause a wash program. The washer/wash head stops moving, but the wash program did not get aborted. The program can get continued by setting the PauseWash flag back to false.
member.remarks: \b Important: The PausWash flag gets reset on start of a new wash program.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SPowerData class.

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.SPowerData.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.SPowerData.AspiratePumpValue
member.summary: Aspirate (suck off) pump power value property

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.SPowerData.DispensePumpValue
member.summary: Dispense (wash) pump power value property

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.SPowerData.TimeFactor
member.summary:
Dispense (wash) time factor property
The dispense (wash) time factor is used to calculate the needed dispense time for a given dispense (wash) volume:\n - Time = \b TimeFactor * Volume + TimeOffset .

member.name: P:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.SPowerData.TimeOffset
member.summary:
Dispense (wash) time offset property
The dispense (wash) time offset is used to calculate the needed dispense time for a given dispense (wash) volume:\n - Time = TimeFactor * Volume + \b TimeOffset .

member.summary: This static class keeps the error code constants of the \ref Sias::WashHead::SWashHeadDevice errors.

member.name: F:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ErrorCodes.NoRobotError
member.summary: 0x10000001: Unable to find a usable robot.

member.name: F:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ErrorCodes.NoHandlingMethods
member.summary: 0x10000002: Unable to find a device for item handling.

member.name: F:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ErrorCodes.InvalidHandlingMethods
member.summary: 0x10000004: Invalid item handling methods or invalid item handling Y/Z device.

member.name: F:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ErrorCodes.TimeoutError
member.summary: 0x1350: Timeout error e.g. vacuum not reached in time

member.name: F:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ErrorCodes.InitError
member.summary: 0x1301: Initialisation error

member.name: F:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ErrorCodes.InitError2
member.summary: 0x1302: Initialisation error

member.name: F:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ErrorCodes.DeviceAlreadyActive
member.summary: 0x13F4: Command not allowed as moodule is already active.

member.name: F:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ErrorCodes.DeviceNotInit
member.summary: 0x13F1: Command not allowed as module is not init yet.

member.name: F:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ErrorCodes.IncorectCommandMessageLength
member.summary: 0x13F1: Incorrect command message length.

member.name: F:Sias.WashHead.SWashHeadDevice.ErrorCodes.NoWashProgram

member.summary: Convert wash Item to washers plate information data block

member.name: T:Sias.WashHead.SWashPositionConverter.SPlateConverter
member.summary: Plate (Item) converter for items with orientation 0°

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashPositionConverter.SPlateConverter.Compare(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary:
Compare method
This comparer allows to sort tip positions by its X/Y positions. Cavities with smaller X values are sorted before those with higher X value. If the X values are identical cavities with higher Y values are sorted before the ones with smaller Y values.

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashPositionConverter.SPlateConverter.GetWashPositions(Sias.Core.Interfaces.SCavityCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get wash positions for 0° orientated washer slot
member.param: The collection of cavities to get washed
false to indicate the plate orientation is identical to teh slot, true otherwise

member.summary:
Compare method
This comparer allows to sort tip positions by its X/Y positions. Cavities with smaller X values are sorted before those with higher X value. If the X values are identical cavities with higher Y values are sorted before the ones with smaller Y values.

member.name: M:Sias.WashHead.SWashPositionConverter.SPlate090Converter.GetWashPositions(Sias.Core.Interfaces.SCavityCollection,System.Boolean)
